quiz.title: Multi-Step Inequality Solving
quiz.subtitle: Unit 6 Quiz 5: Solving Complex Multi-Step Inequalities
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Solving Inequalities Requiring Distribution, Combining Like Terms, and Multiple Steps

questions.question: Solve: $3(x + 2) - 4x ≥ 8$
questions.explanation: Distribute: $3x + 6 - 4x ≥ 8$. Combine: $-x + 6 ≥ 8$. Subtract 6: $-x ≥ 2$. Multiply by -1: $x ≤ -2$. FLIP when multiplying by negative.

questions.question: Solve: $4 - 2(w + 3) ≤ 3w - 1$
questions.explanation: Distribute: $4 - 2w - 6 ≤ 3w - 1$. Combine: $-2w - 2 ≤ 3w - 1$. Add 2w: $-2 ≤ 5w - 1$. Add 1: $-1 ≤ 5w$. Divide by 5: $-\frac{1}{5} ≤ w$ or $w ≥ -\frac{1}{5}$.

questions.question: Solve: $\frac{2x + 1}{3} ≥ x - 2$
questions.explanation: Multiply by 3: $2x + 1 ≥ 3x - 6$. Subtract 2x: $1 ≥ x - 6$. Add 6: $7 ≥ x$ or $x ≤ 7$.

questions.question: Solve: $5(m - 3) - 2m > 3(m + 1)$
questions.explanation: Distribute: $5m - 15 - 2m > 3m + 3$. Combine: $3m - 15 > 3m + 3$. Subtract 3m: $-15 > 3$. This is false, so No Solution.

questions.question: Solve: $3(2z + 1) ≤ 2(3z - 4) + 11$
questions.explanation: Distribute: $6z + 3 ≤ 6z - 8 + 11$. Combine: $6z + 3 ≤ 6z + 3$. Subtract 6z: $3 ≤ 3$. This is always true, so All Real Numbers.

questions.question: Solve: $2 - 3(1 - t) > 4(t - 2) + 5$
questions.explanation: Distribute: $2 - 3 + 3t > 4t - 8 + 5$. Combine: $-1 + 3t > 4t - 3$. Subtract 3t: $-1 > t - 3$. Add 3: $2 > t$ or $t < 2$.

questions.question: Solve: $\frac{3k - 4}{2} - \frac{k + 1}{3} ≤ 2$
questions.explanation: Multiply by LCD 6: $3(3k - 4) - 2(k + 1) ≤ 12$. Distribute: $9k - 12 - 2k - 2 ≤ 12$. Combine: $7k - 14 ≤ 12$. Add 14: $7k ≤ 26$. Divide: $k ≤ \frac{26}{7}$.

questions.question: Solve: $0.5(4x - 6) + 2 > 3(x - 1) - 1$
questions.explanation: Distribute: $2x - 3 + 2 > 3x - 3 - 1$. Combine: $2x - 1 > 3x - 4$. Subtract 2x: $-1 > x - 4$. Add 4: $3 > x$ or $x < 3$.

questions.question: Solve: $2(3 - p) + 4p ≥ 3(p + 2) - 1$
questions.explanation: Distribute: $6 - 2p + 4p ≥ 3p + 6 - 1$. Combine: $6 + 2p ≥ 3p + 5$. Subtract 2p: $6 ≥ p + 5$. Subtract 5: $1 ≥ p$ or $p ≤ 1$.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You handle complex multi-step inequalities including distribution, combining terms, fractions, and special cases.
scoreMessages.70: Strong skills! Focus on: 1) Careful distribution, 2) Combining like terms correctly, 3) Identifying no solution/all real numbers cases.
scoreMessages.50: Good progress. Practice systematic approach: 1) Distribute, 2) Combine like terms, 3) Move variable terms, 4) Solve, 5) Check special cases.
scoreMessages.0: Start with distribution, then combine like terms on each side. Move variable terms to one side, constants to other. Watch for false statements (no solution) or always true (all real numbers).
